author: Yosef MacGruber

text:
By "too many children in a household" I meant when there is too many children for the parents to adequately support (economically, for example). Like I said before, many governments recommend for couples to carefully consider how many children they have because too many can prevent them from achieving a better standard of living. For example, trying to take care of too many children might result in some of them having to sacrifice their education so that they can support their family by working, and then when they are older they can't get jobs with a better salary because they didn't get the education needed.

I don't quite understand what you when by "more and more people would be glad to live". People are only glad to live when they actually exist and have a conscience; if you don't exist yet then how could you be glad to live??

How does sex education promote perversion? In my classes it was usually informative, such as how the reproductive system works and the risks of having unprotected sexual intercourse. Besides, who else is going to teach adolescents about these things?

Also, please remember that not everyone is religious. I don't really understand what you mean when you are saying that contraceptives are unnatural and anti-life, how so?

The planet cannot accommodate for everyone because there aren't enough resources, even now we are straining the planet's natural equilibrium and harming many of its ecosystems. Please think of what happens in an ecosystem when there is too much of one species. Resources run out and the population of that species starts to die off. For example, conflicts about water resources and how much pollution one country is emitting are huge issues that are related to human population sizes.

Not everyone has the urge to have children or even have a romantic relationship, and I don't see anything wrong with that.
author: Catherine Mai

text:
@Catherine Mai 
It is not the government's place to be "recommending" that people have fewer children. How do you keep ignoring the immense value and sacredness of every human life?

What if the parents can support their large families? What if economies were not rigged by corrupt governments, to spread poverty?

Education can also be done by home-schooling and internet-schooling, which now has almost no cost per child. More children do not make it more expensive. Books are becoming replaced by electronic-books, that have minimal costs of publishing, and there is so much educational content that is absolutely free on the internet. Rather than building expensive government monopoly school buildings, we could also have students stay home and study their lessons and take quizes on their Android tablets.

I heard of somewhere, I guess some rich person's foundation funding the mass-production of cheap computers for developing countries, computers that could be powered with a hand-crank, for just $100 per computer, I think it was. With the modern technology, such computers could come with lessons preloaded on them, taking a student all the way through college-level courses. And obviously these computers can be used in villages that do not even have electricity. Yet so much of the world, is already electrically-wired.

People are glad to live after the fact, thus it is good that more people be conceived and come alive, before the fact. Just because you may not yet be aware of your desire to live, does not mean that your conception was some sort of "mistake" or unnecessary.

Sex Ed is perversion, because it is usually run by perverts. Come on, do not ignore the political realities. I am not talking about those old drawings in biology or human health textbooks, of the human reproductive organs. It would seem to have literary merit and educational content. But back in the day, it wasn't promoting all the sexual immorality. I have even seen at a bookstore (because I know to check for things to monitor the decline of the American culture), some children's book about the human body or something, and it showed a cartoon drawing of the erect penis fully inserted into the vagina, and the baby growing in the womb on the next 2 facing pages. Not one mention of sex outside of marriage, nor of sexual perversions, nor of the rampant contraceptive pushing, nor of the trendy and stupid mad-scientist concern that maybe the planet now has just too much human life. Thus, why would I object to such "Sex Ed", as I didn't find the usual perversions in it? I much agree that the reproductive organs should be ever connected and used for reproduction. It seems to have literary merit, and parents who do not approve, need not buy that book. Also, such a book probably does meets community standards now, as it just seems to be that everybody just has to have, and is having so much sex.

How can you deny that contraceptives are unnatural? Obviously, humans were designed to multiply, and to not use birth control. We should not hinder the natural flow of human life, as even nature wants us to grow, and because it so benefits more people. If the human life is flowing more and more, then so be it. If human reproduction is becoming more and more a mighty force of nature then we should embrace and respect that, and even promote the proper and natural transition towards an increasingly populous world. Most people naturally are opposed to imposition of population control upon humans, and huge numbers of people actually do not see any real need to restrain human fertility. They are okay with their fertility and make no effort to go against the nature and the human life in trying to control it. This is not just religion, but also philosophy, and respect for nature in allowing for and welcoming the natural increase of humanity.

I understand the concern about human life just increasingly filling up and dominating the biosphere. As a pro-lifer, of course I have no objection to this eventuality or reality. But that does not at all mean that human rights should be lessened, nor that the natural reproductive urges reduce any, nor that every human life, is somehow not as precious. Just because populous countries such as China and India might be spewing massive pollution into the planet, does not at all mean that just "too many" babies is to blame. Don't forget, they are manufacturing your stuff, for Westerners. What do you expect when they are run by crappy communist or inept governments, and we have so over-regulated pollution restrictions, so as to export our jobs to countries with not so much environmental standards? You don't solve pollution problems by polluting the human body directly with contraceptives. Also, I do not believe that nature is out to get us. Pollution is not as bad of a problem, as the rampant contraceptive pushing that really attacks moral values, pushes for cruel abortions, and is just really so harsh against the human life. Just because there are too many people peeing into the ditch or the rivers, does not mean that there are too many people, rather than they need to modernize and to get more toilets.

But most people do have the very powerful natural urge to reproduce, and most people do produce children, and to "Stop at just 2 children", which is say to be "replacement level" reproduction, is needlessly harsh, unrealistic, and unnecessary. There is so much that can be done, to better support the further natural growth of human populations.
author: Yosef MacGruber

text:
I don't think I am ignoring the value of human life, I am just saying that it is better for families to carefully consider how many children they want to have and how many they can actually adequately support, especially if they want to achieve a better standard of living. Governments usually recommend this because it is more beneficial overall for the family and prevents people from staying stuck in poverty. Didn't I already explain why?

I don't believe all governments are corrupt... Maybe in countries that are more behind on development, but I am in the optimal belief that most governments are trying to do what they think is best for their country (or so I hope).

Sex education is important because it ensures that children get the education they need about the subject through their school. If it wasn't mandatory in schools, I'm not sure that young adolescents would get all the information they need, or even at all. This duty may be neglected by the child's parents/guardians or the may not necessarily inform the child adequately enough about the subject, so it is better for schools, which have set standards on what to teach, to take up this duty. Students may also be more comfortable learning about this subject through their teachers rather than their parents/guardians, but if not they are always welcome to opt out (as long as a signature is provided to do so). I don't see how sex education today promotes sexual immorality, what are you referring to? I don't think sex education is run by "perverts" either, the teachers are usually respectable people... how could you say that? What is it that they are possibly teaching that could be perverted? I have never thought anything I learned in sex education was really "perverted"; it was primarily educational. Some students ask questions that may seem a bit inappropriate, but that's just the students and their curiosity.

I still don't quite understand why you consider contraceptives unnatural, and why that is a bad thing. For example, grass is meant to grow but we still mow our lawns to keep it neat... that's kind of how I see birth contraceptives as. How is it "against nature"? If we invented birth contraceptives, then surely it is completely natural for us to use them to our needs? It isn't harming anyone. You also say that since human reproduction is a force of nature, we should embrace it. Well, isn't disease, drought, and famine also a force of nature? Why don't we embrace that, too, and let people die freely as it is supposedly "nature's will"? With the creation of life also always comes death, both are equally a "force of nature", are they not? I know this is a bit extreme, but that is kind of how your mindset/perspective seems to me. Besides, humans are always trying to control nature to some extent. Pesticides, herbicides, agriculture and cultivation, all of these are examples. If we want to respect nature. we would/should not exploit the planet to such an extent that we are causing so many species to become endangered. In fact, many species today are becoming extinct primarily due to human activity. Also, the rate and extent in which we are exploiting the planet's natural resources is unsustainable and extremely harmful to many ecosystems.

Also, the use of contraceptives is completely up to the each individual as to whether they are going to use them or not. I don't think anyone is pushing anyone to use them!

I agree that population control should not mean human life needs to be devalued. However, I also believe that we need to take responsibility for the damage we are causing our planet. This is our only home, so we need to value it as well and treat it carefully. Pollution IS a very serious problem, probably more so than population control. Where do you think our waste goes? Sewage usually if not always ends up getting dumped into rivers and oceans. What about domestic trash? It ends up in landfills or incinerators (that cause air pollution from burning the waste). Even fertilizers used on farms is a source of pollution, because it gets into bodies of water and causes eutrophication. Even our energy sources (coal, natural gas, fossil fuels, oil, nuclear) creates waste that is considered detrimental. All of the waste we produce goes right back into the environment (nuclear waste is kind of an exception, as it gets stores in specific facilities, but nevertheless still the environment). If we increase our population, pollution will only increase unless we somehow revert to a more sustainable way of living.

I truly do believe that as more females are empowered, they will not be as pressured to marry so early and have children. Females will have more options as to what path they will follow, instead of seeing motherhood as inevitable. More and more females feel less obligated to have many children or commit to maternal duties exclusively, giving them freedom to choose how to live. Women can still choose to have as many children as they want, but it is becoming more common for them to choose other options or be satisfied with one or two children.

Also, more people does not necessarily benefit more people. I don't really see how that works?
author: Catherine Mai

text:
@Catherine Mai 
Isn't it better to more fairly consider the many reasons why it is good for more people to have more children?
 
I don't think I am ignoring the value of human life, I am just saying that it is better for families to carefully consider how many children they want to have and how many they can actually adequately support, especially if they want to achieve a better standard of living. Governments usually recommend this because it is more beneficial overall for the family and prevents people from staying stuck in poverty. Didn't I already explain why?

What business is it of government, to be recommending against children? I do not expect for government to take the wicked anti-life anti-family position of Planned unParenthood, and to violate our religious values using our tax money to promote immorality.

Again you are assuming that people should be pressured to use birth control, after you know that so many people simply believe in allowing babies to push out without any fertility control measures.

Having fewer children does little towards promoting a better standard of living. You can have the same house be the home of 2 children, or of 6 children. Whatever do you think that bunk-beds were invented? Probably for the natural-large families, that do not yet have the large family to match.

Why are you opining that money is of greater value than children? As if having children was some sort of luxury, rather than a biological or religious duty?

I don't believe all governments are corrupt... Maybe in countries that are more behind on development, but I am in the optimal belief that most governments are trying to do what they think is best for their country (or so I hope).

Most governments are corrupt, and if they were not so corrupt, then they would recognize that it is not in their jurisdiction or moral rights, to be denying or advocate against people enjoying having their children. Quite many politicians are professional liars, and ever scheming how to keep themselves in power, and giving too little thought as to what is moral or good for the country.

Sex education is important because it ensures that children get the education they need about the subject through their school. If it wasn't mandatory in schools, I'm not sure that young adolescents would get all the information they need, or even at all. This duty may be neglected by the child's parents/guardians or the may not necessarily inform the child adequately enough about the subject, so it is better for schools, which have set standards on what to teach, to take up this duty.

Sex Ed promotes immorality, as it is usually run by sex perverts. Sex Ed encourages young people to indulge in sex, no matter that they are not yet married. The Bible clearly places the responsibility for children, with the parents, and not with evil edu-crats. Schools are supposed to answer to parents, thus not be so apt to accuse parents of not doing their duties. If politicians were not so much controlling the money, and if parents paid tuition to the school of their choice, then schools probably would be more eager to listen to the parents - their customers. Schools used to be more run by churches, and not by immoral liberal-retards.

Students may also be more comfortable learning about this subject through their teachers rather than their parents/guardians, but if not they are always welcome to opt out (as long as a signature is provided to do so). I don't see how sex education today promotes sexual immorality, what are you referring to?

Ignorance is not an argument. Why don't you do some serious research into the controversy?

Given how controversial that Sex Ed obviously is, why wouldn't it be Opt In? That you have to have a parent's permission even to attend? Why isn't more than one view available? Why not multiple programs, and see which is more popular? Are liberal-retards afraid that more students and parents may actually choose abstinence-based?

Sex Ed by its very nature, is religious, so why is a "religious" moral view, somehow banned? Why does Planned Parenthood sue, anytime an abstinence-based or faith-based Sex Ed is installed? Because it doesn't sell them enough abortions? Because abstinence-based doesn't promote a demand for shoddy nasty contraceptives? Because being moral, doesn't honor Satan whom they follow?

I don't think sex education is run by "perverts" either, the teachers are usually respectable people... how could you say that?

Ignorance isn't an argument. Then why do they bring in "experts" pushing contraceptives? I think many doctors would not even be comfortable with that position, as contraceptives obviously have a lot of serious problems.

I think I may have had a biology teacher say something about sex, but it seemed that at the time, or at least in the area where I attended school, teachers were of moral persuasion and probably attended a good church. And sex is very simple, so there really is not much to say about it. Sex Ed is not even enough to fill a course. It can be covered in a few pages of a textbook, or in a week.

What is it that they are possibly teaching that could be perverted? I have never thought anything I learned in sex education was really "perverted"; it was primarily educational. Some students ask questions that may seem a bit inappropriate, but that's just the students and their curiosity.

Well I went to some presentation at college, that was clearly morality and abstinence-based. And this was at a secular university.

Contraceptives are not God's standard. No sex until marriage, babies after. What is so complicated about that?

I still don't quite understand why you consider contraceptives unnatural, and why that is a bad thing. For example, grass is meant to grow but we still mow our lawns to keep it neat... that's kind of how I see birth contraceptives as. How is it "against nature"? If we invented birth contraceptives, then surely it is completely natural for us to use them to our needs? It isn't harming anyone.

I have nothing against mowing grass nor trimming the bushes. We like to alter nature to better meet the needs of the burgeoning human population. Do you even know the true reason why people started mowing grass? It is primarily a means of fire control. Overgrown brush has a way of catching on fire, during summer droughts.

Why had humans done apparently quite well without contraceptives, for over 5000 years of our history? (According to the Jewish calendar, the world is around 5776 years old.)

Do you mow your arms and legs, to keep them from getting too long? Yet we prune our bushes all the time. That goes to show, that the human life is to be treated differently and more special, than some other aspects of nature.

You also say that since human reproduction is a force of nature, we should embrace it. Well, isn't disease, drought, and famine also a force of nature? Why don't we embrace that, too, and let people die freely as it is supposedly "nature's will"?

Which is preferable? Human reproduction, or those negative things that you mentioned? We are commanded in Deuteronomy 30;19 to choose life, that thou and thy seed may live. Is that not clear enough? How about the Ten Commandments, which you can read in Exodus 20. Thou shalt not kill. Yet abortion is considered almost like just another horrible method of birth control? Why don't we more properly support the natural increase of humanity, as was the obvious position to take before all the evil NWO rampant contraceptive pushing? The population is becoming more and more, and so we should better develop in support of that.

Why would nature want for people to die? Especially from easily preventable or treatable diseases? We see in nature that life seeks to spread into almost every niche that it can. Why not all the more so, for supposedly intelligent human life?

With the creation of life also always comes death, both are equally a "force of nature", are they not?

The Bible says that death is defeated in the end. Thus, they can not be regarded equally. We should favor life, obviously as we seem to like being alive. So why should there be anything wrong with human births occurring at a rate of nearly 3 times that of the deathrate?

I know this is a bit extreme, but that is kind of how your mindset/perspective seems to me. Besides, humans are always trying to control nature to some extent. Pesticides, herbicides, agriculture and cultivation, all of these are examples. If we want to respect nature. we would/should not exploit the planet to such an extent that we are causing so many species to become endangered. In fact, many species today are becoming extinct primarily due to human activity. Also, the rate and extent in which we are exploiting the planet's natural resources is unsustainable and extremely harmful to many ecosystems.

Humans have to alter nature, because we read in Genesis 1;26 that God gave dominion to man, over nature and over other creatures. Also, because there are now just so many of us. But why do humans dominate? I think that verse could be speaking of the sheer numbers, that God would ultimately grow us into. As a few scattered villages would be utterly unable to dominate the planet.

Why are you trying to defend the wrong but trendy, Malthusian "overpopulation" dogma? I am trying to get you to see, that there are far better population theories than that. What about the writings of Julian Simon, Boserub, Steven Mosher, Ben Wattenberg?

Also, the use of contraceptives is completely up to the each individual as to whether they are going to use them or not. I don't think anyone is pushing anyone to use them!

Not according to those who are pushing the rampant contraceptive pushing. Ignorance is not an argument.

I agree that population control should not mean human life needs to be devalued. However, I also believe that we need to take responsibility for the damage we are causing our planet. This is our only home, so we need to value it as well and treat it carefully. Pollution IS a very serious problem, probably more so than population control. Where do you think our waste goes? Sewage usually if not always ends up getting dumped into rivers and oceans. What about domestic trash? It ends up in landfills or incinerators (that cause air pollution from burning the waste). Even fertilizers used on farms is a source of pollution, because it gets into bodies of water and causes eutrophication. Even our energy sources (coal, natural gas, fossil fuels, oil, nuclear) creates waste that is considered detrimental. All of the waste we produce goes right back into the environment (nuclear waste is kind of an exception, as it gets stores in specific facilities, but nevertheless still the environment). If we increase our population, pollution will only increase unless we somehow revert to a more sustainable way of living.

What ever happened to the subject of conservation? Responsible land practices? Now it is radical enviro-extremism. Aimed against the benefit of man.

If you do not want human life devalued, then you have to stand against any hint of human population "control". Every human life is of immense value and sacred.

Needless damage is being done, by evil NWO criminal elitists, and not so much by the common people. What is the point of fluoride poison in our water, GMO pollution in our food, and chem-trails in the air?

I heard somewhere that trash costs around $30 per ton, to dispose of in a sanitary landfill. That is trivial compared to the sacred and immense value of a human life! Parent should not at all discount the great value of another human baby born into the world, due to such distractions as the 6000 disposable diaper that that child may use.

Natural gas burns cleanly. Even propane burns quite clean. People have vent-free gas log sets that can even go into a fire box with no chimney, and gas stoves, that emit their products of combustion, straight into the room air. It is mostly just water vapor and carbon dioxide, what you yourself breath out.

If we increase in population, many people have good ideas of how to do stuff, and the technology increases, and we adapt to the increasingly population. It is win-win for everybody.

You also seem to conveniently forget, that world population is increasing as we speak. Perhaps we do not even have any choice about it - We will increase.

I truly do believe that as more females are empowered, they will not be as pressured to marry so early and have children.

And what if they want to marry early and to have more children?

Females will have more options as to what path they will follow, instead of seeing motherhood as inevitable.

Yet I read authors who say that feminism has messed it up to that men and women can't seem to get married anymore.

More and more females feel less obligated to have many children or commit to maternal duties exclusively, giving them freedom to choose how to live. Women can still choose to have as many children as they want, but it is becoming more common for them to choose other options or be satisfied with one or two children.

And why the perverse social pressure to not have more than 2 children?

Also, more people does not necessarily benefit more people. I don't really see how that works?

More people are around to benefit. There is this philosophical concept of the Utilitarian Principle, that says that often the best thing to do is that which most benefits the most people. Even some website remarked about the population implications. If population rises, more people then benefit. Even it argues against any measures of population control, as the more populous we can become, the more people around to benefit.
author: Yosef MacGruber

text:
Please remember that not everyone is religious and therefore do not share the same beliefs. I would rather you not refer to religious resources, as those are your beliefs and I think we should keep this argument factual.

What people define as sexually immoral may be different from how you define it. It is not really your place to tell others how they should deal with their sex lives. Also, I still do not understand how sex education promotes "immorality" if it is only educational. Even if you think I am ignorant, it would be helpful if you clarify on what you mean.

There's nothing wrong with a government recommending families to have less children if they are doing it to benefit the family overall... of course, families are not obligated to comply but it truly is to benefit the family so that they can achieve a better standard of living. I don't understand how that would be violating your religious beliefs or how it is promoting immorality...

Having fewer children does promote a better standard of living, due to the economic constraints of having children. Again, for example, some parents may not be able to provide their children with adequate education for them to be able to get a job with a higher paying salary. No one is pushing contraceptives on anyone, they are simply an option out there for those who do wish to use them. If people don't wish to use them, then they are free not to. I am also not in the opinion that money is of greater value of children, what did I say to make you think that? I am simply saying that it is better to have less children if you cannot adequately provide for all of them... it is very sad for a family to realize that they have compromised their children's opportunities to get out of poverty because they had more children than they could support, or too many at one time. Not that they would actually regret having their children ( I doubt anyone would), they would only regret not being able to sufficiently provide for all them or making a better decision to wait until they could support more children. So yes, having children is a luxury in that sense. I recommend you read the book The Last Hunger Season by Roger Thurow. It's really good!

How does sex education encourage people to indulge in sex? I have never gotten that implication from any of my classes. It was simply educational. I do not believe I am being ignorant in any sense, so please explain what it is I am being ignorant of.

We clip our toenails and fingernails. We cut our hair, and females often shave or wax off their facial and body hair. This is all for the sake of convenience or appearance. Of course we would not cut off our legs and arms, that would be detrimental rather than convenient. All contraceptives do is prevent sperm from contacting an egg, no one is being harmed, so I don't see what is wrong with people using them. I don't think it is really anyone's place to be telling others how they should deal with their sex lives. If you don't like contraceptives, then you can simply choose not to use them. Governments may be promoting the use of contraceptives, but definitely not pushing people to use them! Where do you get that notion? It would be very helpful if you could please provide an example.

I do not believe you understand the severity of environmental issues and how they relate to economic issues. What do you mean the subject of conservation? Conservation is the practice of setting aside land for wildlife, waste management is a different subject. What did I say that was extreme? That was mostly factual albeit general information. Also, dealing with climate change and other environmental issues that we are responsible for is not that simple. Even technology has a limit on what it can do. More people also means more resources necessary to provide for everyone. What do you think would happen if everyone in the world lived at the same standard of living people do in the US? We (most of the more developed countries) are already living very unsustainably and depleting our natural resources rapidly. Even now with such a high population so negatively impacting the environment, we have failed to "adapt". If we continue to negatively affect the environment, we will only negatively affect ourselves and others. 

If a woman want to get married early and have a large family, that's fine. It's their choice, ultimately, but females should never be pressured into a certain lifestyle, especially if they wish to pursue another kind.

Also, in the past, women married mainly out of duty and because it was really their only option. Now women can go and do other things. I do not understand how feminism prevents men and women from being married if that is what a couple wants. Feminism promotes gender equality, since women are often given the shorthand in many cases compared to men.

There is no social pressure to not have more than two children, what are you referring to? Raising children is a very difficult (not to mention expensive) task, especially if the mother is pursuing a career, so most females feel satisfied with having only one or two children as they aren't being pressured to have more anymore.

More people usually causes more competition for resources. Therefore, not always the case.
author: Catherine Mai

text:
@Catherine Mai 
Why is it supposedly okay for pagans to push their false religious beliefs, but it is deemed strange if I promote truth?

Please remember that not everyone is religious and therefore do not share the same beliefs. I would rather you not refer to religious resources, as those are your beliefs and I think we should keep this argument factual.

There's nothing wrong with a government recommending families to have less children if they are doing it to benefit the family overall...

The government is not my Daddy, nor the government my God. Do you not have any concept of limited government? Are you just an evil and stupid statist? Do you even know what that word, statist, means?

of course, families are not obligated to comply

False economic theories and Mathusian theory assertions.

Having fewer children does promote a better standard of living, due to the economic constraints of having children.

That is your opinion, and not at all supported by facts. Why don't you say something equally stupid, such as having a smaller house, or having fewer cars, does promote a better standard of living, due to economic blah-blah-blah? See what I did there? I exposed that you were assuming that having children is a bad investment of one's time, and that children are not a blessing. Some people might actually choose to have a smaller home or to not have a car if they live in a country with good transportation options, but those are mere material and optional things, that do not have the immense and sacred value, that children, or every human life, does have.

Again, for example, some parents may not be able to provide their children with adequate education for them to be able to get a job with a higher paying salary.

So that explains why nasty contraceptives were not even needed but a half century ago. Oh wait, it does not. Why has the society become so hostile against childbearing?

We wouldn't even need so much money, if it wasn't for all the government corruption, and its A through Z taxes. Yes, there really is an A through Z list out there. Do a search.

No one is pushing contraceptives on anyone,

Ignorance is not an argument. Ted Turner, Bill Gates, Hillary Clinton, there are quotes out there, proving otherwise.

they are simply an option out there for those who do wish to use them.

Driving off the embankment is simply an option out there for those who choose to kill themselves. Should we then remove guard rails from dangerous drops and from the sides of bridges? Why are you pushing for the crappy contraceptives? Why are you conveniently ignoring that huge numbers of people have objections to all methods of birth control?

If people don't wish to use them, then they are free not to.

"MAINTAIN HUMANITY UNDER 500,000,000 IN PERPETUAL BALANCE WITH NATURE" -Georgia Guidestones

People free to reject contraceptives? Well since the evil NWO plans to murder over 90% of the world population anyway?

I am also not in the opinion that money is of greater value of children, what did I say to make you think that?

Do you want the long list, or the short list? Well the long list would be obviously too long for me to list. Almost everything that you have said thus far.

I am simply saying that it is better to have less children if you cannot adequately provide for all of them...

So do you hate other people's large families, and why?

it is very sad for a family to realize that they have compromised their children's opportunities to get out of poverty because they had more children than they could support, or too many at one time.

Malthusian assertions, yet Malthusian "overpopulation" dogma is false.

You are being negative against children, for no good reason.

Not that they would actually regret having their children ( I doubt anyone would), they would only regret not being able to sufficiently provide for all them or making a better decision to wait until they could support more children.

So everybody should have but only 1 child, because that will somehow magically make them rich enough to give their children many 1000s of toys? Nobody in the world, should have to sleep in a bunk-bed or wear "hand-me-down" clothes? I have had used clothes, that were just fine, sometimes almost new.

So yes, having children is a luxury in that sense. I recommend you read the book The Last Hunger Season by Roger Thurow. It's really good!

I doubt that that is an author who I want to read. Especially if somebody like you recommended it.

How does sex education encourage people to indulge in sex?

So you really have no idea what they promote in Sex Ed? Didn't I already describe some of it?

I have never gotten that implication from any of my classes. It was simply educational. I do not believe I am being ignorant in any sense, so please explain what it is I am being ignorant of.

I don't know so much, what kind of classes you had. But I suspect the the moral aspects and spiritual bonding of sexual relationships, were seriously downplayed, as that often is the case.

Do you have a real question here, or are you feigning ignorance?

We clip our toenails and fingernails. We cut our hair, and females often shave or wax off their facial and body hair.

I do not shave my body hair. Whatever for? It is not excessive, and it is self-limiting. To shave overly much, is not natural nor is it necessary. Facial and head hair, is another story, as that seem to grow out and out, if it is not occasional trimmed.

This is all for the sake of convenience or appearance. Of course we would not cut off our legs and arms, that would be detrimental rather than convenient. All contraceptives do is prevent sperm from contacting an egg,

Which aims to prevent actual real future people who would not want to have been prevented. Why do you keep insisting that humans should use contraceptives, when our ancestors thought otherwise? Were they wrong, or are we wrong today? What is wrong with a sperm contacting the egg? Birthing babies is just as natural and proper as eating, as breathing, as the heart beating. A vital life process.

no one is being harmed,

Even if nasty contraceptives are being rampantly pushed? Do you really see it as right, for pushy "family planning" workers to foist nasty contraceptives on other cultures, just trash their cultures, ignore their tradition preferences for large families, promote phony Western scarcity based upon false economic models, and outright Nazi eugenics and racism? If you want your eyes opened, then read the books, Killer Angel and Grand Illusions by George Grant. But you do not seem to even want to know the truth?

so I don't see what is wrong with people using them.

Contraceptives damage and sabotage the human body, and aim to prevent the proper and natural growth and spread of human life.

I don't think it is really anyone's place to be telling others how they should deal with their sex lives.

Why don't you tell the evil liberal-retards pushing their immoral Sex Ed, that claim?

If you don't like contraceptives, then you can simply choose not to use them.

Well until large families come to be more persecuted, for supposedly contributing to "overpopulation", even though Malthusian "overpopulation" is not supported by science?

Governments may be promoting the use of contraceptives, but definitely not pushing people to use them!

Ignorance is not an argument. China, India, etc. A cheap transistor radio for a man in India getting sterilized? Talk about cheap and disrespectful anti-family bribes? How insulting can those evil "family planning" pushers be?

Where do you get that notion? It would be very helpful if you could please provide an example.

Am I your paid person tutor? Why are you so ill-informed? You can't google stuff where you live?

I do not believe you understand the severity of environmental issues and how they relate to economic issues.

I understand the claims. But I do not at all agree with them. Outright stupidity and lies.

What do you mean the subject of conservation? Conservation is the practice of setting aside land for wildlife, waste management is a different subject.

text:
I don't know what your solution might be, as the eco system or mother nature has its own economic system, humans built their own economy. Natural resources are means of exchange for us to survive, if you truly believe that the real economy is water, livestock, vegetation, arable soil, you are suggesting us to go back to stone age and live in the wild world. That might be nice, but kills a lot of people. I don't know how those extreme environmentalists think its moral as human being to think that. Look, you probably think I'm a dirty capitalist just by tackling you, but you must see what is happening in the world, and I highly doubt you and I will not be able to comprehend everything whats happening in the world as we speak. 

My country "South Korea" is covered with more than 70% of forest and once we've lost all of forest during the war. But right after the war, people started planting trees and recycle garbage voluntarily, and it was very successful. We recovered most of the forest and we drink much clean water than other Asian countries, all those might not have been possible if we didn't accept the system which you call it "The monetary structured ill minds"  or "False Money". Our economy grew with industry and eco system together, we developed technology to purify the water most efficiently by borrowing money from global credit system and people imported seeds from other countries to plant trees from nothing by borrowing money from other creditors. This is the most productive way in which our humanity has adopted, and you think it is purely evil?. Do you know that Tesla makes electric cars by borrowing from false economy ?, they make no profit and burning down the cash every quarters, and yet they are still surviving. if we had no credit based system, companies like Tesla will have no chance to survive. 

Everyone on earth wish to have clean air and water, no fools want to drink dirty water. So people do actually work to protect the nature. But what is really annoying me is that after all these Climate change projections from IPCC and other institutions constantly fail to prove their theory (Man-made climate change). text:
Absolutely correct.   The climate will change as it must... either we must repeal the Laws of Thermodynamics, or we focus human actions  in 3 ways:   We must  endure suffering, Adapt, and Mitigate
    To suffer is to accept and endure; we make an active choice to hunker-down and face a painful situation.
    To adapt is to tap into resilience as we take real action to survive and co-exist.
    To mitigate is to work on real processes to make the problem less severe in the future.

    Palliation, Civilization, Revision
    We help with suffering by easing pain with palliative care to ourselves and others.
    We best adapt when we band together in shared effort to build human civilization.
    We make tomorrow better as we revise our failed systems by radical reformation and innovation. have to organize and focus human action on adaptation and mitigation.

text:
@Y0ureWelcomeWorld  - no, quite the contrary - historically, the periods moving from an Interglacial to glaciation within our ice age, are marked by short term, severe shocks.  Periods even compressed down into a couple of weeks.  

As we were heading toward the current Interglacial, there was an abrupt reversal to near glacial lows 12000 prior, then a 4000yr slow recovery, followed by an incredibly fast warming period that dwarves our last 100 years. text:
+Fla-bushcraft Prepper  The problem is you are going out of your way to obfuscate the information, then blaming stupid people.  You are selecting for people who are heavily invested in your message being true, and do not realize you are giving off red flags that you don't know what you're talking about or are lying profusely.  Searching for the agenda-specific keywords you either intentionally or ignorantly provide means they get search results from your camp that display your narrative: this is not how real research is done, and will lead you awry and into fake news every time.  This is the nature of any popularly controversial topic; if you have no experience with how to search properly, you will just feed yourself into the hype machine.

The fact that scientists have been wrong in the past is not surprising or evidence in favour of one theory over another; if you will only believe in those who are never wrong, you aren't looking for science you're looking for prophets and religious dogma ("oh, he was wrong? false prophet.  he wasn't real therefore his clear failure doesn't impact the credibility of real prophets").  That's the nature of trying to learn about the world.  Science is not about absolute belief that the current science is true no matter what because we say so, but rather that it is the best information that we have at the time.  This is where personal verification comes in; and you don't check something controversial properly by searching one-sided dogmatic keywords like "gender spectrum explained" or "why we know ghosts are real".  You have to actually learn about the issues at hand.  It is actually easier to simply lap up keywords by someone like you, speaking authoritatively and conspiratorially while being extremely vague about verifiable facts that work against them and yet very specific about others parts of their story that will funnel you to articles that come from their social microcosm and reinforce their beliefs.  So your argument that you speak the way you do because you don't like to teach stupid people, is actually a hollow excuse; your words are those of a propagandist (intentional or not), not a guide to verifiable truth.

To really research global warming for yourself you need to investigate in order to understand a lot of things: what is being claimed in the "dominant narrative", whether you believe it or not; what argumentation this narrative gives as evidence, and how valid it is; what premises this argumentation works from, and if they are supported by the data; what data these premises use as a basis, and how various instances of it are collected; and whether in the big picture these all make sense with each other and with science in general.  On top of that, you need to have a firm grasp of basic science and how to learn, as well as how to discern trustworthy information and sound arguments from garbage.  Being able to discern the motives of people you are communicating with is very important here, as well as being able to discern your own motives when communicating.  So it is not surprising that many people are not knowledgeable or or virtuous or tenacious enough to research an issue adequately.

The fact that your comment is clearly copy-pasted (makes references to graphs that aren't) shows your low personal level of learning, lack of mastery of your arguments, and your very low care for the actual (not claimed) truth of what you say.

text:
Abundant means sufficient to meet needs. In this way, there is ample supply of all atmospheric gas, and thus they are equally abundant.

Equilibrium means the intake and discharge of oxygen and carbon dioxide by organisms; the most abundant gas, nitrogen is neutral and serves as the pavement, the foundation and the footings of Earth's atmosphere. Increases in oxygen result from plant growth, which consume carbon dioxide to do so. Carbon dioxide is liberated into the atmosphere from many sources, principally biological decay and combustion. Carbon dioxide is created from the decay of carbon monoxide, a direct result of combustion. Hydrocarbon combustion in vehicles is converted to dioxide quickly in the emissions phase, eliminating the short, several hour span of monoxide and harmful effects. The great majority of hydrocarbon combustion conducted for heat production on Earth is but a fraction of the carbon dioxide output that occurs. 

Carbon dioxide content of the atmosphere has not increased forty percent on Earth, as suggested. Spot measurements on the surface might reveal this figure; there are other factors not considered as they are not measured and unable to be measured, at this point.

Human technology does not measure the total volume of Earth's atmosphere; it is not static. Also not measured is the difference in concentrations at altitude. There is not a homogeneous mixture of Earth atmosphere gases; carbon dioxide is heavier than the two atom oxygen molecule and shows higher concentrations closer to the surface.

Humans measure concentrations in more densely populated areas, where human use of fuels increases the concentration temporarily. Long term study and analysis of gaseous concentrations far from human populations and activities, such as across vast, un-populated land masses and over oceans and at altitudes above these locations, across Earth's surface, would reveal differences not considered now.

The percentage increases and declines in oxygen and carbon dioxide are indeed much different, because the base amounts are so different. Gaseous equilibrium of these two substances has long been present on Earth, where the exchange in amounts is relatively even, by molecule. Thus one molecule of carbon dioxide, with two oxygen atoms is consumed by a plant, which liberates two atoms of oxygen, or one molecule, as part of its biological process. The carbon atom remains in the plant, along with hydrogen and is liberated when the plant dies and decays. Individual species vary this greatly, yet across any area of surface vegetation, the weighted average is nearly always one to one. This aspect of plant biology is not measured, as the total population of plants, trees and vegetable life is difficult or impossible to accurately measure. 

There will be no collapse of the human population from climate variation, which is beyond control of human beings. Human activity has not caused erratic weather and cannot, within all activities. We suggest human production of water vapor or steam could have a greater effect yet also immaterial against the total evaporation of hydrogen dioxide, or water, that now occurs. Even if humans were to liberate steam in material amounts, equilibrium of temperature would result and the average temperatures at the surface would fall. Increased precipitation would cause this. 

Erratic patterns of weather currently observed on Earth are set against a brief sliver of Earth climate history, and have as cause the inner planet temperature variations affecting sea water temperatures far below surfaces, where temperatures have varied.

The seawater temperature variations at depth cause the shift in deep water current, caused by faster rise and fall of water currents and layers, which behave much as do differing layers of air, yet operate more quickly and with greater effect, given the density of seawater and depth pressures.

Humans do not and cannot measure seawater layers or temperatures many thousands of feet below the surface, where the action occurs, as humans would describe it in English.

Magnetic field variations and their effect on the Earth's core alter the heat reaching the surface, most greatly affecting seawater. The hard surface to land interface is a far less efficient thermocouple, as Earth understanding knows well. Solid to liquid is vastly more efficient and were it possible to measure Earth crust temperatures one to three meters below the ocean floors and also seawater temperatures just above the ocean floor, in approximately twenty five to twenty eight thousand key locations, this would be apparent and revealing. 

We hope you enjoy this very simple insight into Earth understanding and physical behavior heretofore not studied and not understood. Much greater explanations of Earth operation and physical properties will be offered in the coming years, as we detect need and also willingness to embrace ideas not able to be measured.

Human scientific process correctly requires objective measurement before acceptance of effects occurs, yet this also places a large barrier to consideration of theories - or facts we offer here - because the ability to verify is not yet present. 

This view towards science will alter in the coming decades as technologies and capabilities considered impossible are demonstrated. We refer to an episode of a popular human television program named Star Trek; in this program, one episode mentions transparent aluminum. Indeed there will be demonstrated the ability to create a material with weight, strength and density of this metal and the transparency of glass. 

Our thanks and appreciation for your questions, and also our gratitude for the enjoyment we will have upon observation of the reaction to our statements. A great honor to be offering these ideas to humanity. What we have said here has not been told to humans by energetic beings guardian angel guides, such as ourselves and the permission for which we are eternally grateful to have been granted.

Be well and always.
author: Scott Rayborne

text:
Abundant means sufficient to meet needs. In this way, there is ample supply of all atmospheric gas, and thus they are equally abundant.

Equilibrium means the intake and discharge of oxygen and carbon dioxide by organisms; the most abundant gas, nitrogen is neutral and serves as the pavement, the foundation and the footings of Earth's atmosphere. Increases in oxygen result from plant growth, which consume carbon dioxide to do so. Carbon dioxide is liberated into the atmosphere from many sources, principally biological decay and combustion. Carbon dioxide is created from the decay of carbon monoxide, a direct result of combustion. Hydrocarbon combustion in vehicles is converted to dioxide quickly in the emissions phase, eliminating the short, several hour span of monoxide and harmful effects. The great majority of hydrocarbon combustion conducted for heat production on Earth is but a fraction of the carbon dioxide output that occurs. 

Carbon dioxide content of the atmosphere has not increased forty percent on Earth, as suggested. Spot measurements on the surface might reveal this figure; there are other factors not considered as they are not measured and unable to be measured, at this point.

Human technology does not measure the total volume of Earth's atmosphere; it is not static. Also not measured is the difference in concentrations at altitude. There is not a homogeneous mixture of Earth atmosphere gases; carbon dioxide is heavier than the two atom oxygen molecule and shows higher concentrations closer to the surface.

Humans measure concentrations in more densely populated areas, where human use of fuels increases the concentration temporarily. Long term study and analysis of gaseous concentrations far from human populations and activities, such as across vast, un-populated land masses and over oceans and at altitudes above these locations, across Earth's surface, would reveal differences not considered now.

The percentage increases and declines in oxygen and carbon dioxide are indeed much different, because the base amounts are so different. Gaseous equilibrium of these two substances has long been present on Earth, where the exchange in amounts is relatively even, by molecule. Thus one molecule of carbon dioxide, with two oxygen atoms is consumed by a plant, which liberates two atoms of oxygen, or one molecule, as part of its biological process. The carbon atom remains in the plant, along with hydrogen and is liberated when the plant dies and decays. Individual species vary this greatly, yet across any area of surface vegetation, the weighted average is nearly always one to one. This aspect of plant biology is not measured, as the total population of plants, trees and vegetable life is difficult or impossible to accurately measure. 

There will be no collapse of the human population from climate variation, which is beyond control of human beings. Human activity has not caused erratic weather and cannot, within all activities. We suggest human production of water vapor or steam could have a greater effect yet also immaterial against the total evaporation of hydrogen dioxide, or water, that now occurs. Even if humans were to liberate steam in material amounts, equilibrium of temperature would result and the average temperatures at the surface would fall. Increased precipitation would cause this. 

Erratic patterns of weather currently observed on Earth are set against a brief sliver of Earth climate history, and have as cause the inner planet temperature variations affecting sea water temperatures far below surfaces, where temperatures have varied.

2. However we should still know that our actions are based on solid scientific evidence. And we should heed climate scientists' warnings.
3. You could also make a little Game Theory diagram. Then you'll notice:
A.Just let climate change happen => if this is wrong =>everybody dies
B.Do something about it => if this is wrong => we spend a lot of money to live in a healthier world, less pollution, species stop dying out,etc...
What would you do A or B?

text:
I agree, but we don't really have time to educate … well, who? The whole world to engineer level? Meaning a BSC or BA in Englineering? The thing is, we needed to make major structural, socio-cultural shifts in attitudes and behaviours a couple of generations ago. It's pretty much too late now. We can try and salvage the very worst effects, but really, there's an awful lot of pain and damage locked in to the inevitable warming en route to the homes near you now. 

So what i think David is saying is: It's way too late to care about the minutae of scientific quibbling and latest scientific findings; the main point is we need to continue to make major structural changes on the international, national, and local (regional and suburban) scales, and as soon as possible, because AGW is affecting us right now in all these very personal ways (price of insurance, food, way increased risks, etc.).
author: Andrew White

text: Though I agree with your statement, what I have found when speaking to deniers is that the approach mentioned in this video actually helps makes some of these "global warming is an evil liberal conspiracy" people question their own thinking. For example, I was speaking to a friend that believed that all the data was fabricated no matter the amount empirical evidence and peer review research I showed him. However, when I mentioned that salt water marshes in Texas are already being taken over by black mangroves and that South Carolina, despite being a red state, is investing research into making their struggling peach crop more resilient to the recent warming that has put stress on yields, he was slightly dumbfounded. Sometimes it's more effective to point out the palm tree in the deniers back yard that couldn't grow there 25+ years ago than it is to show them numerical data.

text:
How does it not make sense?  Are you apologizing because you do not understand?  Please point out what part of the response was poorly written and I will restate my argument.  For the moment, I'm going to put aside your attempt at person insult for a moment.  Our ability to objectively observe and perform scientific inquiry is central to the advancement of most of the modern achievements. More to the point, all forms of wisdom, including science and engineering ARE REQUIRED to solve whatever problem that global climate change presents.  

I challenge you to use your powers of objective observation.   Are you not typing your insulting response using a computer made from plastic which originates from an industrial complex that produces greenhouse gasses?  If you are in the United States, it is very likely that you are using energy from a fossil fueled power plant of some kind.  If you own a computer, its statistically likely that you also own an automobile or partake in fossil fueled transportation, or otherwise support the geopolitical environment that is ultimately contributing to the perceived global warming.  In order for you to actually disagree with me, you are helping cause climate change.

Climate change is a very scary thing.  I never disagreed that pollution is a significant problem.  I only disagree with this idea for reasons stated above.  I understand where his idea is coming from, but it comes from a place of desperation and fear.  Nearly drowning in a flood must have caused extreme anxiety.  Most propaganda comes from a very similar place.  Feel free to disagree with me, I accept and it is your right to do so.  But I warn you, fear and desperation are the wrong tools to use to find a solution here.  Suspension of scientific reason has potential to turn this into mindless propaganda.  Historically I recall the Spanish Inquisitions and Nazi death camps use mindless propaganda lead to awful atrocities.

text:
@Aanthanur DC  You keep citing Arrhenius as though he were some sort of demigod in your pantheon of the Catastrophic Anthropogenic Global Warming.  Sad.  Arrhenius was wrong about sensitivity, didn't seem to understand his own notion that CO2 was logarithmic and developed a theory of acids and bases that was wrong.  Now, that isn't to say he was a dufus.  Clearly the man was erudite and accomplished a great deal and deserves our admiration and respect.  But he got two key aspects wrong.
1.  Sensitivity, as far we know, to date, is far far less than 5 degrees.
2.  The atmosphere will not become opaque to CO2.  That is, the effect CO2 has grows less as the concentration goes up, where, theoretically, as some concentration there is no further effect.
As I've told you before, the 'Greenhouse Effect' is a poor metaphor for the radiative effect of CO2.  In On the Influence of Carbonic Acid in the Air upon the Temperature of the Ground by him, he never uses the term.  Good for him.
Now read this:  http://motls.blogspot.com/2008/01/why-is-greenhouse-effect-logarithmic.html
